meanings.def: the unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia and several other countries
examples: You will be paid in American dollars.
He sold the company in a multimillion-dollar deal.
American taxpayers ought to have more say in how their tax dollars are spent.
China is pumping out billions of dollars worth of exports.
per dollar The company generates an additional $4 in sales per dollar spent on ads.

meanings.def: the value of the US dollar compared with the value of the money of other countries
examples: The dollar closed two cents down.
Wow, you look like a million dollars.

meanings.def: used to say that you are certain that something will happen
examples: You can bet your bottom dollar that he'll be late.
Wow, you look like a million dollars.

idioms.idiom: you can bet your life/your bottom dollar (on something/(that)…)
idioms.def: used to say that you are certain that something will happen
examples: You can bet your bottom dollar that he'll be late.

related: pay, earn, charge, etc. top dollar
you can bet your life/your bottom dollar (on something/(that)…)
